speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: SCENE IX. The Roman camp.

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Flourish. Alarum. A retreat is sounded. Flourish.  Enter, from one side, COMINIUS with the Romans; from the other side, MARCIUS, with his arm in a scarf

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: If I should tell thee o'er this thy day's work,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Thou'ldst not believe thy deeds: but I'll report it

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Where senators shall mingle tears with smiles,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Where great patricians shall attend and shrug,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: I' the end admire, where ladies shall be frighted,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: And, gladly quaked, hear more; where the

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: dull tribunes,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: That, with the fusty plebeians, hate thine honours,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Shall say against their hearts 'We thank the gods

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Our Rome hath such a soldier.'

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Yet camest thou to a morsel of this feast,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Having fully dined before.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Enter TITUS LARTIUS, with his power, from the pursuit

speaker: LARTIUS
text_entry: O general,

speaker: LARTIUS
text_entry: Here is the steed, we the caparison:

speaker: LARTIUS
text_entry: Hadst thou beheld--

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Pray now, no more: my mother,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Who has a charter to extol her blood,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: When she does praise me grieves me. I have done

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: As you have done; that's what I can; induced

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: As you have been; that's for my country:

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: He that has but effected his good will

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Hath overta'en mine act.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: You shall not be

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: The grave of your deserving; Rome must know

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: The value of her own: 'twere a concealment

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Worse than a theft, no less than a traducement,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: To hide your doings; and to silence that,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Which, to the spire and top of praises vouch'd,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Would seem but modest: therefore, I beseech you

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: In sign of what you are, not to reward

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: What you have done--before our army hear me.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: I have some wounds upon me, and they smart

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: To hear themselves remember'd.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Should they not,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Well might they fester 'gainst ingratitude,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: And tent themselves with death. Of all the horses,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Whereof we have ta'en good and good store, of all

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: The treasure in this field achieved and city,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: We render you the tenth, to be ta'en forth,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Before the common distribution, at

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Your only choice.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: I thank you, general;

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: But cannot make my heart consent to take

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: A bribe to pay my sword: I do refuse it;

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: And stand upon my common part with those

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: That have beheld the doing.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: A long flourish. They all cry 'Marcius! Marcius!'  cast up their caps and lances: COMINIUS and LARTIUS stand bare

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: May these same instruments, which you profane,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Never sound more! when drums and trumpets shall

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: I' the field prove flatterers, let courts and cities be

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Made all of false-faced soothing!

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: When steel grows soft as the parasite's silk,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Let him be made a coverture for the wars!

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: No more, I say! For that I have not wash'd

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: My nose that bled, or foil'd some debile wretch.--

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Which, without note, here's many else have done,--

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: You shout me forth

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: In acclamations hyperbolical;

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: As if I loved my little should be dieted

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: In praises sauced with lies.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Too modest are you;

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: More cruel to your good report than grateful

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: To us that give you truly: by your patience,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: If 'gainst yourself you be incensed, we'll put you,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Like one that means his proper harm, in manacles,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Then reason safely with you. Therefore, be it known,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: As to us, to all the world, that Caius Marcius

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Wears this war's garland: in token of the which,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: My noble steed, known to the camp, I give him,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: With all his trim belonging; and from this time,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: For what he did before Corioli, call him,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: With all the applause and clamour of the host,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: CAIUS MARCIUS CORIOLANUS! Bear

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: The addition nobly ever!

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Flourish. Trumpets sound, and drums

speaker: All
text_entry: Caius Marcius Coriolanus!

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: I will go wash;

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: And when my face is fair, you shall perceive

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Whether I blush or no: howbeit, I thank you.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: I mean to stride your steed, and at all times

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: To undercrest your good addition

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: To the fairness of my power.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: So, to our tent;

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Where, ere we do repose us, we will write

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: To Rome of our success. You, Titus Lartius,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Must to Corioli back: send us to Rome

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: The best, with whom we may articulate,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: For their own good and ours.

speaker: LARTIUS
text_entry: I shall, my lord.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: The gods begin to mock me. I, that now

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Refused most princely gifts, am bound to beg

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Of my lord general.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Take't; 'tis yours. What is't?

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: I sometime lay here in Corioli

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: At a poor man's house; he used me kindly:

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: He cried to me; I saw him prisoner;

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: But then Aufidius was with in my view,

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: And wrath o'erwhelm'd my pity: I request you

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: To give my poor host freedom.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: O, well begg'd!

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Were he the butcher of my son, he should

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Be free as is the wind. Deliver him, Titus.

speaker: LARTIUS
text_entry: Marcius, his name?

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: By Jupiter! forgot.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: I am weary; yea, my memory is tired.

speaker: CORIOLANUS
text_entry: Have we no wine here?

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Go we to our tent:

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: The blood upon your visage dries; 'tis time

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: It should be look'd to: come.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Exeunt
